subject: Add "sudo make distclean" to cleanup_ovn for devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-06 13:09:04.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/networking-ovn'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/21d9731b860e2baa3742ea9f8ce4c7a85386b40e', 'message': 'Add "sudo make distclean" to cleanup_ovn for devstack

After kernel updated, kernel devel-lib was updated as well, generated
makefile in OVS became stale, that using unstack.sh and then stack.sh
can't re-compile new OVS kernel module.
Add "sudo make distclean" to cleanup_ovn to wipe generated makefile.

Change-Id: Id18b64f7a7fe92c484798e2a66b31bff14f2d39e
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add "sudo make distclean" to cleanup_ovn for devstack

After kernel updated, kernel devel-lib was updated as well, generated
makefile in OVS became stale, that using unstack.sh and then stack.sh
can't re-compile new OVS kernel module.
Add "sudo make distclean" to cleanup_ovn to wipe generated makefile.

Change-Id: Id18b64f7a7fe92c484798e2a66b31bff14f2d39e
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/76/454176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [April 1 tomorrow] The most standard way for node authentication
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 12:25:15.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/node-authentication.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs/commit/7f0fa5a245ef9728f9cb35bdf131065ec54e412d', 'message': '[April 1 tomorrow] The most standard way for node authentication

Change-Id: I439d237d403c1c9c16c730732036fa138cde154e
'}]
commit_message:
[April 1 tomorrow] The most standard way for node authentication

Change-Id: I439d237d403c1c9c16c730732036fa138cde154e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/82/452182/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Hardware nodes authentication ============================= April 1 tomorrow This spec proposes the most standard mechanism for hardware nodes authentication. Problem description =================== Ironic has non-authenticated API endpoints for ramdisk callback. Because API is "external" service this causes problems like [#]_. Current solution can be separate API services with unauthentificated endpoints for ramdisks, and disable these endpoints for external requests via policies. Alternative solution can be create internal authentication mechanism for deploy ramdisks. The main problem on this way is passing secret (key, token) to the node. Most of technologies which used for remote boot (PXE, iPXE, DHCP) is not very secure. Also problem can be resolved with hardware node authentication, if we know that request comes from proper node that is deploying or is cleaning. There are many technologies which can be used for hardware node authentication, but they use specific hardware, standard or vendor solutions and are not common. This spec proposes solution that covers near all production hardware. Proposed change =============== There is only one hardware requirements: out of band soft power off support. Soft power off always translated to ACPI [#]_ G2(S5) notification, handled by OS and can be disabled by OS tools. In modern Linux systems soft off on top level handled and can be disabled via ``systemd-logind`` (the part of systemd service) [#]_. Also there is special mechanism for temporary block soft off via D-Bus. We assume that management network that connected BMC internal ports is isolated and trust. Baremetal node authentication workflow: * Ironic conductor service prepares boot configuration. * After some configurable time IPA deploy driver start to send soft off requests distributed in the time randomly, without waiting of results, there is some value of minimal pause between requests. * Ramdisk with IPA has soft off disabled by default. After starting it blocks and enables soft off. We should see these lines in system log: "<DATE TIME> systemd-logind[<pid>]: Power key pressed." without real power off. * Ramdisk collects messages mentioned above during some time, configurable via ironic config. * IPA send collected time sequence as JSON body to API "lookup" endpoint. * Ironic try to find corellation between time sequences, started from last time in request. There will be delay, can be different clock time, jitter etc. But even in dumb algorithm when we send or not send request each 5 second interval we can have more 2^20 variants diring time less than 2 min. With more sophisticated corellation algoritm situation will be better. During quick test on the old and cheap hardware I got stable 4 seconds delay, jitter lesser than 1 second. * If sequence is shorter that defined by config variable error returned. * If corellation test passed ironic generate, save and returns in the body key that IPA should use for authorization during deploy or cleaning. Alternatives ------------ Mentioned above. Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- "lookup" endpoint should accept mentioned sequence started from new version. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None RPC API impact -------------- New method for passing lookup info should be added. Driver API impact ----------------- Power drivers should accept zero timeout on soft off. Nova driver impact ------------------ None Ramdisk impact -------------- Ramdisk should be changed as mentioned. Security impact --------------- This feature improves security. Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ Deploy and cleaning time increases. Other deployer impact --------------------- Mentioned config options should be added. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== Developer documentation will be updated. References ========== .. [#] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1659455 .. [#] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Configuration_and_Power_Interface .. [#] https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd-logind.service.html

commit_message:
Remove Ubuntu Trove postinst script hack

trove-common version 1:7.0.0-0ubuntu1~cloud0 coming from the following repo
https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/docker/base/sources.list.ubuntu#L11
has been fixed.

Temporary hack must be removed.

Change-Id: I19ce6f0a5d5f0fe0d390fcb05f775f860abd146c

commit_message:
Update networking-generic-switch jobs

This patch updates networking-generic-switch jobs:
  * Run ironic-multitenant-multinode job in voting mode starting from
    Pike+
  * Drop old bash script job as it was replaced by tempest.
  * Still run ironic-multitenant single node for Newton/Ocata

Change-Id: Ia5f0e35611f37ffc38e25e5ad6702120f491a58c

commit_message:
Only set MTU on brbm-inspector if IRONIC_IS_HARDWARE==FALSE

The brbm-inspector interface doesn't get create when IRONIC_IS_HARDWARE
is false, this causes devstack to blow up.

Change-Id: Ib8bc9b9f8e61e11f06bef4a1c1e3c40706b7ae18
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/33/454633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo ip link set dev brbm-inspector mtu $PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU
deleted_lines: sudo ip link set dev brbm-inspector mtu $PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU

commit_message:
Fix link in QoS devref

The QoS devref has a bad link to the L2 agent extensions
doc. This patch fixes the link.

Note: The bug reports a few other neutron dead links, but
these are either already fixed, or for liberty release notes
and liberty is already EOL.

Change-Id: I047f638f0a348d636aa533c0db93e8a1f23c6356
Closes-Bug: #1652944

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/86/309386/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Recovering the pacemaker cluster ----------------------------------- General recovery, maintenance mode. Point to the graph of the service dependencies (constraints) like `this one`_. Recovering the cluster after a failed upgrade step ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Fails during the controller upgrade: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ First thing sanity check whether there a problem with the yum update itself. Are the repos setup correctly in /etc/yum.repos.d/. Can you see a list of packages that have been updated in /var/log/yum.log? If you are able to diagnose and remedy any issue with the repos and/or node connectivity you can try to re enable the cluster resources and try the controller upgrade again. In two terminals login to controller 0 as well as controller 1 and switch to the root user. We will use controller 1 for monitoring and controller 0 to execute the commands for bringing the cluster back up. On controller 1 do:: watch -d pcs status On controller 0 do:: Start the cluster: pcs cluster start --all Watch the output in controller 1. You should see all three controllers being reported as online like:: PCSD Status: overcloud-controller-0: Online overcloud-controller-1: Online overcloud-controller-2: Online Start to enable services in the following order on controller-0, making sure the given service starts on all three controllers before moving onto the next. For example after enabling the first service mongod make sure you see the transition in control 1 from:: Clone Set: mongod-clone [mongod] Stopped : [ overcloud-controller-0 overcloud-controller-1 overcloud-controller-2 ] to:: Clone Set: mongod-clone [mongod] Started : [ overcloud-controller-0 overcloud-controller-1 overcloud-controller-2 ] Enable mongod:: pcs resource enable mongod Enable memcached:: pcs resource enable memcached Enable rabbitmq:: pcs resource enable rabbitmq Enable redis:: pcs resource enable redis Enable keystone:: pcs resource enable openstack-keystone Enable httpd:: pcs resource enable httpd Finally restart the swift service(s). If you have stand-alone swift nodes then you only need to restart openstack-swift-proxy on the controller. Otherwise you need to start all the swfit services. We use systemctl since swift isn't managed by pacemaker:: services=( openstack-swift-account-auditor openstack-swift-account-reaper openstack-swift-account-replicator openstack-swift-account openstack-swift-container-auditor openstack-swift-container-replicator openstack-swift-container-updater openstack-swift-container openstack-swift-object-auditor openstack-swift-object-replicator openstack-swift-object-updater openstack-swift-object openstack-swift-proxy ) # when you don't have stand-alone swift nodes OR, if you have stand-alone swift nodes:: services=( openstack-swift-proxy ) for S in ${services[@]}; do systemctl start $S; done Fails during the converge step: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Cluster in maintenance mode. .. _this one: http://acksyn.org/files/tripleo/wsgi-2016-02-24-cib.pdf

commit_message:
Adds the ctlplane subnet update for nameserver to tripleo.sh

As per the docs it uses 192.168.122.1 for virt and 8.8.8.8
otherwise. User can also override by exporting
CTLPLANE_DNS_IP="1.2.3.4"

Change-Id: Id9c13d3af3a389fcee009b1d66b29ee497300b19
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/72/238072/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " --ctlplane-dns -- Configure DNS for nodes on ctlplane."CTLPLANE_DNS=${CTLPLANE_DNS:-""} --ctlplane-dns) CTLPLANE_DNS="1"; shift 1;;function ctlplane_dns { log "Configure DNS for undercloud ctlplane subnet" stackrc_check if [ -z ${CTLPLANE_DNS_IP+x} ]; then ctlplane_subet=$(neutron net-list | grep 'ctlplane' | awk '{print $6}') #use 192.168.122.1 for virt, or 8.8.8.8 CTLPLANE_DNS_IP="192.168.122.1" a_node_id=$(ironic node-list | grep -m 1 available | awk '{print $2}') pxe_ssh=$(ironic node-show $a_node_id | grep 'driver.*pxe_ssh') if [ -z ${pxe_ssh+x} ]; then CTLPLANE_DNS_IP="8.8.8.8" fi fi log "Configure DNS - updating ctlplane subnet $ctlplane_subnet with DNS $CTLPLANE_DNS_IP" neutron subnet-update $ctlplane_subet --dns-nameserver $CTLPLANE_DNS_IP log "Configure DNS - DONE } if [ "$CTLPLANE_DNS" = 1 ]; then ctlplane_dns fi ctlplane_dns

subject: WIP Simple firstboot script that enables (if any) swap partition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 16:44:25.000000000', 'files': ['firstboot/enable_swap.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/feae87572125388b0922a9ad424b3b9b688053c0', 'message': "WIP Simple firstboot script that enables (if any) swap partition

Mainly for testing nothing to see here

For puppet-based deploys of the overcloud-full.qcow2 it isn't
possible to enable swap space (at least I couldn't). You can use
a flavor with swap defined, but though Ironic seems to create
the partition correctly (fdisk -l) this is then not enabled in
the resulting nodes. This script can be called as firstboot by
using an environment file like:

resource_registry:

Change-Id: Id3d426c6542b9befc9a4fc09eebe71db652e9950

commit_message:
WIP Simple firstboot script that enables (if any) swap partition

Mainly for testing nothing to see here

For puppet-based deploys of the overcloud-full.qcow2 it isn't
possible to enable swap space (at least I couldn't). You can use
a flavor with swap defined, but though Ironic seems to create
the partition correctly (fdisk -l) this is then not enabled in
the resulting nodes. This script can be called as firstboot by
using an environment file like:

resource_registry:
    OS::TripleO::NodeUserData: ../firstboot/enable_swap.yaml

Change-Id: Id3d426c6542b9befc9a4fc09eebe71db652e9950
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/96/217796/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2014-10-16 resources: userdata: type: OS::Heat::MultipartMime properties: parts: - config: {get_resource: swapon_config} swapon_config: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig properties: config: | #!/bin/bash swap_device=$(sudo fdisk -l | grep swap | awk '{print $1}') if [[ $swap_device && ${swap_device} ]]; then rc_local="/etc/rc.d/rc.local" echo "swapon $swap_device " >> $rc_local chmod 755 $rc_local swapon $swap_device fi outputs: OS::stack_id: value: {get_resource: userdata}

revisions:

The element uses iptables to block dhcp/bootp requests from already
enrolled hardware (by querying ironic), in pretty much exactly the

discovered machines).

filter can be invoked by cron (x>=1minute integer value). An
alternative is to have a bash script managed by the systemd service

commit_message:
WIP: Adds a discovery-dhcp element

This element adds a systemd/upstart service that spawns a dnsmasq
process TODO: add configuration - interface and dhcp alloc. range.

This dnsmasq process is intended to serve only new and undiscovered
machines. Already enrolled hardware continues to be served by the
neutron-dhcp-agent spawned dnsmasq process(es) (and this/ese is/are
already explicitly told not to answer calls from unknown machines).

The element uses iptables to block dhcp/bootp requests from already
enrolled hardware (by querying ironic), in pretty much exactly the
same way as the older bm-dnsmasq element, with a cronjob setup to
periodically update the chain (to include for example recently
discovered machines).

One drawback of this approach is the limit with which the MAC
filter can be invoked by cron (x>=1minute integer value). An
alternative is to have a bash script managed by the systemd service
that loops forever (and updates every x seconds). Regardless of the
time interval an alternative to using iptables is to use a dhcp
hostfile (passed to dnsmasq when invoked) and update that with 'MAC,
ignore' entries (and then sighup dnsmasq) as a means of filtering.

Change-Id: I258e9243b7be1a02779f3e90a8e03ace01abc4d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/90/119390/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Adds a discovery-dhcp element This element adds a systemd/upstart service that spawns a dnsmasq dnsmasq process TODO: add configuration here (e.g. for interface). This dnsmasq process is intended to serve only new and undiscovered machines. Already enrolled hardware continues to be served by the neutron-dhcp-agent spawned dnsmasq process(es) (and this/ese is/are already explicitly told not to answer calls from unknown machines). The element uses iptables to block dhcp/bootp requests from already enrolled hardware (by querying ironic), in pretty much exactly the same way as the older bm-dnsmasq element, with a cronjob setup to periodically update the chain (to include for example recently discovered machines). An alternative is to use a dhcp hostfile with 'MAC, ignore' entries (and then sighup dnsmasq).

commit_message:
remove bagpipe_bgpvpn agent extension

now that it moved to networking_bagpipe

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ L2 Agent extension to support bagpipe networking-bgpvpn driver RPCs in the OpenVSwitch agent """ from networking_bagpipe.agent import bagpipe_bgp_agent from neutron_lib import constants as n_const from neutron.agent.l2 import agent_extension from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.common \ import constants as ovs_agt_constants class BagpipeBgpvpnAgentExtension(agent_extension.AgentCoreResourceExtension): def initialize(self, connection, driver_type): if driver_type != ovs_agt_constants.EXTENSION_DRIVER_TYPE: raise Exception("This extension is currently works only with the" " OVS Agent") # Create an HTTP client for BaGPipe BGP component REST service self.bagpipe_bgp_agent = bagpipe_bgp_agent.BaGPipeBGPAgent( n_const.AGENT_TYPE_OVS, connection, int_br=self.int_br, tun_br=self.tun_br, ) def consume_api(self, agent_api): self.int_br = agent_api.request_int_br() self.tun_br = agent_api.request_tun_br() def handle_port(self, context, data): pass def delete_port(self, context, data): pass

commit_message:
Karbor services restarting issue on conf update

In case of karbor-protection providers.d/openstack-infra.conf config file modification,
karbor-operationengine and karbor-api are restarted too, but they should
not.

karbor-operationengine startup command:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/karbor/templates/karbor-operationengine.json.j2#L2

karbor-api startup command:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/karbor/templates/karbor-api.json.j2#L2

Change-Id: I91a0273ccf46e340315cf885ea01db6e14653182
Closes-Bug: #1677542

commit_message:
Run Watcher-API behind mod-wsgi

This patch adds support to run watcher-api
with mod-wsgi. It provides
1. wsgi app script files, to run watcher-api under apache.
2. updated devstack plugin to run watcher-api default with
   mod-wsgi.
3. Document to deploy watcher-api behind wsgi.

Change-Id: I8f1026f0b09fd774376220c2d117ee66f72421b8
Closes-Bug: #1675376

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # This is an example Apache2 configuration file for using # Watcher API through mod_wsgi Listen 9322 <VirtualHost *:9322> WSGIDaemonProcess watcher user=stack group=stack processes=2 threads=2 display-name=%{GROUP} WSGIScriptAlias / /opt/stack/watcher/watcher/api/app.wsgi SetEnv APACHE_RUN_USER stack SetEnv APACHE_RUN_GROUP stack WSGIProcessGroup watcher ErrorLog /var/log/httpd/watcher_error.log LogLevel info CustomLog /var/log/httpd/wathcer_access.log combined <Directory /opt/stack/watcher/watcher/api> WSGIProcessGroup watcher WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL} AllowOverride All Require all granted </Directory> </VirtualHost>

commit_message:
Trove services restarting issue on conf update

In case of trove-api service config file modification (trove.conf file),
trove-conductor and trove-taskmanager are restarted too, but they should
not.

trove-conductor startup command:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/trove/templates/trove-conductor.json.j2#L2
=> trove.conf is not used

trove-taskmanager startup command:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/trove/templates/trove-taskmanager.json.j2#L2
=> trove.conf is not used

Change-Id: Ic4703a571cec5bf8b3f91cfcb9da1a23e2bb300b
Closes-Bug: #1677531

commit_message:
Don't get container's logs if it is creating

Server might return a 400 error on getting logs on container with
"Creating" state.

Change-Id: I0bc16c15ca91698713a98368d3263ac8b8764536

subject: Set default value of 'dvr_extra_resources' option to False
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 11:47:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/13ea5d4128186083b823c23ab07199bcd3a4e79d', 'message': 'Small changes in the logic of test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent

If the DVR extension is disabled, the router will be automatically hosted
by some L3 agent (or by a few agents if the L3 HA extension is enabled)
when creating it. If the DVR extension is enabled, the router will be
automatically hosted by some L3 agent (or by a few agents if the L3 HA
extension is enabled) when adding an internal network interface to it.
So in both cases we already have the router that will be hosted at least
by one L3 agent before the test starts. That is why we should remove the
router from the L3 agent(s) in the resource_setup method.

Change-Id: Idb39e7d60e01bf4a0abf42b1003f0b60fe56cded
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-27 12:03:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/5669d3563d6bafdbe50aec97eb45164c957987d2', 'message': "Small changes in the logic of test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent

If the DVR extension is disabled, the router will be automatically
hosted by some L3 agent (or by a few agents if the L3 HA extension
is enabled) when creating it. If the DVR extension is enabled, the
router will be automatically hosted by some L3 agent (or by a few
agents if the L3 HA extension is enabled) when adding an internal
network interface to it. So in both cases we already have the router
that will be hosted at least by one L3 agent before the test starts.
That is why we should remove the router from the L3 agent(s) in the
resource_setup method.

The current code works fine when we have only one L3 agent.
Actually, the router is already hosted by the L3 agent before the test
starts, but Neutron doesn't complain when we add the router to the L3
agent in the test. But the test may fail when we have more than one L3
agent because Neutron may raise the following error:

tempest.lib.exceptions.Conflict: An object with that identifier already
exists
Details: {u'message': u'The router <router-id> has been already hosted
by the L3 Agent <agent-id>.', u'type': u'RouterHostedByL3Agent',
u'detail': u''}.

Change-Id: Idb39e7d60e01bf4a0abf42b1003f0b60fe56cded
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-07 17:49:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/821696330a494647ffd69edb73d43714b52c3740', 'message': "Fixing test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent when >= two L3 agents

The test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent test may fail with the following
error if we have more than one L3 agent in the cloud:

tempest.lib.exceptions.Conflict: An object with that identifier already exists
Details: {u'message': u'The router 8569d347-6db4-4e12-b033-60a867ba680f has
been already hosted by the L3 Agent 6250d031-d455-4afe-b993-5a7719815746.',
u'type': u'RouterHostedByL3Agent', u'detail': u''}

The full log you can find here http://paste.openstack.org/show/508686/

The test tries to add a router to L3 agent and fails because the router is
already hosted by another L3 agent. A router is automatically hosted by some
L3 agent after the router is created. When the DVR extension is enabled,
a router is automatically hosted by some L3 agent after we added an internal
network interface to the router.
In the resource_setup method we create a router that will be already hosted
at least by one L3 agent before the test starts. The test works with one L3
agent because Neutron allows us to add a router to the same L3 agent.

So this patch is intended to resolve the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1590049

Change-Id: Idb39e7d60e01bf4a0abf42b1003f0b60fe56cded
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-07 18:03:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/19948b3f33e1ef006b4f143dc7f2284efbb66e34', 'message': "Fixing test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent when >= two L3 agents

a router is automatically hosted by some L3 agent after we added an internal

at least by one L3 agent before the test starts. The test works with one L3
agent because Neutron allows us to add a router to the same L3 agent.

So this patch is intended to resolve the issue.

"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2016-09-02 13:41:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/95aad8db24f33f5dbcdf140a120490dfb6ab9db7', 'message': "Fixing test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent test

The issue is observed when the DVR extension is enabled. When DVR is
disabled, the resource_setup method just creates a router. When DVR is
enabled, the resource_setup method creates a router and then adds an internal
network interface to the created router. After we added the internal network
interface to the router, the router is automatically hosted by a L3 agent.
So the test may fail if we have more than one L3 agent in the cloud with the
error like this:

tempest.lib.exceptions.Conflict: An object with that identifier already exists
Details: {u'message': u'The router 8569d347-6db4-4e12-b033-60a867ba680f has
been already hosted by the L3 Agent 6250d031-d455-4afe-b993-5a7719815746.',
u'type': u'RouterHostedByL3Agent', u'detail': u''}

The full log can be find here http://paste.openstack.org/show/508686/

So this patch deletes the code block that makes the router schedule to
the L3 agent to avoid such conflicts.

Also, the patch adds small improvements to the test.

Closes-Bug: #1590049

Change-Id: Idb39e7d60e01bf4a0abf42b1003f0b60fe56cded

"}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2016-09-08 16:57:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4ae183a18b796cf8864404ad6e96ed2e968574a2', 'message': "Fixing test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent test

The issue is observed when the DVR extension is enabled. When DVR is
disabled, the resource_setup method just creates a router. When DVR is
enabled, the resource_setup method creates a router and then adds an

tempest.lib.exceptions.Conflict: An object with that identifier already exists
Details: {u'message': u'The router 8569d347-6db4-4e12-b033-60a867ba680f has
been already hosted by the L3 Agent 6250d031-d455-4afe-b993-5a7719815746.',

"}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2016-10-10 09:30:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/2289207a52aa85fbf16f48be191ff1f06e574e73', 'message': "Fixing test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent test

The issue is observed when the DVR extension is enabled. When DVR is
disabled, the resource_setup method just creates a router. When DVR is
enabled, the resource_setup method creates a router and then adds an
internal network interface to the created router. After we added the
internal network interface to the router, the router is automatically
hosted by some L3 agent. Then the test starts and tries to add the router
to one of L3 agents and fails because the router is already hosted by
another L3 agent.

tempest.lib.exceptions.Conflict: An object with that identifier already
exists
Details: {u'message': u'The router 8569d347-6db4-4e12-b033-60a867ba680f has
been already hosted by the L3 Agent 6250d031-d455-4afe-b993-5a7719815746.',
u'type': u'RouterHostedByL3Agent', u'detail': u''}

The full log can be find here http://paste.openstack.org/show/508686/

A DVR router can be bound to some L3 agent without adding an internal
network interface to the created router since the Mitaka release.

Liberty - http://paste.openstack.org/show/574456/
Mitaka - http://paste.openstack.org/show/574455/

In order to fix the test, we need to remove the code block where we add
the internal network interface to the router, but it will not work with
the Liberty release. But now the Liberty release is EOL and this patch
fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1590049

Change-Id: Idb39e7d60e01bf4a0abf42b1003f0b60fe56cded

u'type': u'RouterHostedByL3Agent', u'detail': u''}

The full log can be find here http://paste.openstack.org/show/508686/

A DVR router can be bound to some L3 agent without adding an internal
network interface to the created router since the Mitaka release.

Liberty - http://paste.openstack.org/show/574456/
Mitaka - http://paste.openstack.org/show/574455/

In order to fix the test, we need to remove the code block where we add
the internal network interface to the router, but it will not work with
the Liberty release. But now the Liberty release is EOL and this patch
fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1590049

Change-Id: Idb39e7d60e01bf4a0abf42b1003f0b60fe56cded
"}, {'number': 23, 'created': '2016-11-24 11:20:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/7617b89320bd0ee7fa85b7a40384f3e003028e0c', 'message': "Fixing test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent test

The issue is observed when the DVR extension is enabled. When DVR is
disabled, the resource_setup method just creates a router. When DVR is
enabled, the resource_setup method creates a router and then adds an
internal network interface to the created router. After we added the
internal network interface to the router, the router is automatically
hosted by some L3 agent. Then the test starts and tries to add the router
to one of L3 agents and fails because the router is already hosted by
another L3 agent.

tempest.lib.exceptions.Conflict: An object with that identifier already
exists
Details: {u'message': u'The router 8569d347-6db4-4e12-b033-60a867ba680f has
been already hosted by the L3 Agent 6250d031-d455-4afe-b993-5a7719815746.',
u'type': u'RouterHostedByL3Agent', u'detail': u''}

The full log can be find here http://paste.openstack.org/show/508686/

A DVR router can be bound to some L3 agent without adding an internal
network interface to the created router since the Mitaka release.

Liberty - http://paste.openstack.org/show/574456/
Mitaka - http://paste.openstack.org/show/574455/

In order to fix the test, we need to remove the code block where we add
the internal network interface to the router, but it will not work with
the Liberty release. But now the Liberty release is EOL and this patch
fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1590049

Change-Id: Idb39e7d60e01bf4a0abf42b1003f0b60fe56cded

commit_message:
Set default value of 'dvr_extra_resources' option to False

The default value of the option was set to True to support Liberty
which is not supported anymore. So let's set the default value of
the option to False.

Related-Bug: #1590049

Change-Id: Idb39e7d60e01bf4a0abf42b1003f0b60fe56cded
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/322118/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If the DVR extension is disabled, the router will be automatically # hosted by some L3 agent (or by a few agents if the L3 HA extension # is enabled) when creating it. If the DVR extension is enabled, the # router will be automatically hosted by some L3 agent (or by a few # agents if the L3 HA extension is enabled) when adding an internal # network interface to it. So in both cases at this point we already # have the router that will be hosted at least by one L3 agent. That # is why we should remove the router from the L3 agent(s) before the # tests start. agents = ( cls.admin_routers_client.list_l3_agents_hosting_router( cls.router['id'])['agents']) for agent in agents: cls.admin_agents_client.delete_router_from_l3_agent( agent['id'], cls.router['id'])

subject: Ignore IOError when creating 'console.log'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 13:09:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7063d143bab0ef8cec80b798e555889e3c6cde14', 'message': "Ignore IOError when creating 'console.log'

In 'd4e6bd8', and later refined in 'ec6ed24c', an issue with the the
Quobyte CI was resolved by ensuring that the 'console.log' file is
always created, even when libvirt's 'dynamic_ownership' config option
is set to '0'. However, attempting to take ownership of this file can
cause issues when 'dynamic_ownership' is set to '1' and a user attempts
to reschedule an instance to a host where it was previously located. In
this case, the permissions on the file have already been co-opted by
libvirt, and attempting to change them results in an IOError.

The easiest fix for this is to simply ignore the IOError, as the file
already exists and libvirt has set correct permissions already. This is
what do here. A longer term fix would be to avoid changing the
permissions only for the offending Quobytes block devices, but this is
likely not backportable and will be done in a follow-up fix.

Change-Id: I353afd57be207330757580447a1b606c7b9b7c09

Related-bug: #1597644

commit_message:
Ignore IOError when creating 'console.log'

In 'd4e6bd8', and later refined in 'ec6ed24c', an issue with the the
Quobyte CI was resolved by ensuring that the 'console.log' file is
always created, even when libvirt's 'dynamic_ownership' config option
is set to '0'. However, attempting to take ownership of this file can
cause issues when 'dynamic_ownership' is set to '1' and a user attempts
to reschedule an instance to a host where it was previously located. In
this case, the permissions on the file have already been co-opted by
libvirt, and attempting to change them results in an IOError.

The easiest fix for this is to simply ignore the IOError, as the file
already exists and libvirt has set correct permissions already. This is
what do here. A longer term fix would be to avoid changing the
permissions only for the offending Quobytes block devices, but this is
likely not backportable and will be done in a follow-up fix.

Change-Id: I353afd57be207330757580447a1b606c7b9b7c09
Partial-bug: #1634282
Related-bug: #1597644
Related-bug: #1609298

subject: Perform old-style local delete for shelved offloaded instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-05 20:31:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/regressions/test_bug_1675570.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9245bbf79ddbfd8a2e2310af654711f9d3a547b1', 'message': "Perform old-style local delete for shelved offloaded instances

This fixes a regression from some local delete code added for cells v2
where it assumed that if an instance did not have a host, it wasn't
scheduled to a cell yet. That assumption misses the fact that the
instance won't have a host if it was shelved offloaded. And to be
shelved offloaded, the instance had to have first been built on a host
in a cell.

So we simply duplicate the same check as later in the _delete() method
for instance.host or shelved-offloaded to decide what the case is.

Obviously this is all a giant mess of duplicate delete path code that
needs to be unwound, and that's the plan, but first we're fixing
regressions and then we can start rolling this duplication all back
so we can get back to the single local delete flow that we know and love.

Change-Id: Ie2063f621618c1d90aeb59f0f1d7da351862ea9f
Closes-Bug: #1678326
"}]
commit_message:
Perform old-style local delete for shelved offloaded instances

This fixes a regression from some local delete code added for cells v2
where it assumed that if an instance did not have a host, it wasn't
scheduled to a cell yet. That assumption misses the fact that the
instance won't have a host if it was shelved offloaded. And to be
shelved offloaded, the instance had to have first been built on a host
in a cell.

So we simply duplicate the same check as later in the _delete() method
for instance.host or shelved-offloaded to decide what the case is.

Obviously this is all a giant mess of duplicate delete path code that
needs to be unwound, and that's the plan, but first we're fixing
regressions and then we can start rolling this duplication all back
so we can get back to the single local delete flow that we know and love.

Change-Id: Ie2063f621618c1d90aeb59f0f1d7da351862ea9f
Closes-Bug: #1678326

commit_message:
Add repository for project navigator data

The OpenStack Project Navigator would like to consume some data about
the projects. Sticking it into a machine-consumable form in a git repo
seems like the kind of thing we'd do.

Needed-By: I6e15a8b1f433107b84dd6734f68c77d54a9ff793
Change-Id: I51adf4f671437081f460295753c575cd35a65e6d

commit_message:
Run py35 tests on upper-constraints.txt changes

In order to ensure we're not regressing the central list of projects
on upper-constraints changes we'd like to test the py35 jobs
as well. Non-voting until this works.

Change-Id: I8d7fa88da4cb7e71193a27a4cbac9a3f71cbdfd3

commit_message:
MapR 5.1: remove non-existing version of hue

The version 3.7.0 of Hue (or better, its packages) are not available
and the build fails on CentOS 7 and RHEL7.

Closes-Bug: #1675047
Change-Id: Ifd5d8c96dd62cc6def8b785c932221c4987aac62

commit_message:
Enabling (Adding) Octavia to SDK gate.

Currently the fucntional tests written for Octavia controllers in
SDK are not able to hit the API endpoints for respective services.
So the tests are not validated properly. This patch would solve that
by enabling Octavia in SDK gates.
Also adding a local_conf section would enable other projects to add
for similar reasons.

Change-Id: Id64c4d8d33194332b121c16187428b1574144cc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/63/453263/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - local_conf: conf: | [[local|localrc]] "enable_plugin ceilometer git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ceilometer" "enable_plugin neutron https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron" "enable_plugin octavia https://git.openstack.org/openstak/octavia" export PROJECTS="openstack/octavia $PROJECTS"

commit_message:
Add barbican-tempest-plugin tests to Cursive

The barbican-tempest-plugin project contains
scenario tests for security features which use
the cursive library. Adding this job to cursive's
jobs will help ensure that changes to cursive
will not break these features.

Change-Id: Id1f3802d4ed10edf355bfe366c192ec5e4fedad1

commit_message:
Revert "Enable ironic service in congress gate job"

Seems to be causing across-the-board failure on congress dsvm jobs. Reverting now until problem can be diagnosed and fixed.

This reverts commit 940b40d01534e0e6cd17d2d8e2d69b795c333231.

Change-Id: I446ee68814dc4dcaa4ca387c51caabda73930213

commit_message:
Don't try and create the my.cnf.d dir everytime

The creation of /etc/my.cnf.d is not idempotent and is run anytime the
mysql client profile is included. This change adds an unless parameter
to ensure it is only run if not used.

Change-Id: I4a30eaccf72f5687dc22ba93c19136e55d36dcab
Closes-Bug: #1680570

commit_message:
Centralize compute-hyperv config options

This change centralizes the compute-hyperv config options, moving
them to hyperv.nova.conf. We're also making sure this is used
across all modules.

Change-Id: I3f20c2fbf40dd7c7c485f8a26723ca119c5e3c66

revisions:

Closes-Bug: #1680432

commit_message:
Add a check about the range of the parameter 'offset'

If large value is passed as offset to plans, restores,
triggers, etc list api then it throws 500 internal server error.

Add a check about the parameter 'offset', and return 400 status
code if it is out of range.

Change-Id: I5e6a6167c7cd810b1ded87426eaf93c537a2a4a9
Closes-Bug: #1680432

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: If4735fc3ac1803585efd90657539e540d157a59a

commit_message:
Remove fedora-minimal from func tests

It seems there is a bad mirror that is constantly causing this job to
fail.  To keep the gate moving, let's skip this for now.  I will
propose a follow-on revert so we re-enable it after we've debugged
further.

Change-Id: Iafb8579ffbb647f18e848b55dc60a0600ad25b8f

commit_message:
Remove a few trusty-based jobs from nova experimental

Now that liberty is end of life, stable/mitaka is the only
branch that can run on ubuntu trusty nodes and we want to
pair down our list of available jobs a bit. This patch removes
some trusty-based jobs from the nova experimental queue with the
understanding that nova doesn't really need to run these against
stable/mitaka changes, generally either because they don't provide
good coverage or are necessary for the types of fixes that get
backported to stable/mitaka, or just because they probably don't work
on mitaka anyway.

Change-Id: I8a3ee9ed3df1ed08f987b7ae5ea4bed1ed32e758

commit_message:
Use StoryBoard for workload-ref-archs

The Enterprise WG wants to start using StoryBoard for tracking their
own tasks, so set up a project on storyboard.openstack.org
corresponding to their openstack/workload-ref-archs repo. They have
no open bugs on Launchpad, so no need to import anything.

Change-Id: Ia6cb030fefee6590ec0c94470433f20dfc101ea2

commit_message:
Use StoryBoard for openstack-user-stories

The Product WG wants to start using StoryBoard for tracking their
own tasks, so set up a project on storyboard.openstack.org
corresponding to their openstack/openstack-user-stories repo. They
have no open bugs on Launchpad, so no need to import anything.

Change-Id: I8263478b878c6440ddbee24d179ac37877a6a4a1

subject: Add a trigger to call ldap_backend define
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 13:57:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/961c70603cc875f1e20a0271d7057108684af68a', 'message': 'Add a trigger to call ldap_backend define

Ldap_backend is a define so we need a resource to talk it. If ldap_backend_enable set by tripleo-heat-templates, we call the ldap_backend as resource.

Is Tested and works in newton with this environment :
parameter_defaults:
  LdapDomainEnable: true
  ControllerExtraConfig:
    keystone::using_domain_config: true
    keystone::ldap_backend:
      myldap:
        url: ldap://192.0.2.250
        user: cn=openstack,ou=Users,dc=redhat,dc=example,dc=com
        password: keystone
        suffix: dc=redhat,dc=example,dc=com
        user_tree_dn: ou=Users,dc=redhat,dc=example,dc=com
        user_filter:(memberOf=cn=OSuser,ou=Groups,dc=redhat,dc=example,dc=com)
        user_objectclass: person
        user_id_attribute: cn
        user_allow_create: False
        user_allow_update: False
        user_allow_delete: False
    horizon::keystone_multidomain_support: true
    horizon::keystone_default_domain: Default
    nova::keystone::authtoken::auth_version: v3
    cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_version: v3

Closes-Bug: 1677603
Co-Authored-By: Guillaume Cor <gucore@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1593c6a33ed1a0ea51feda9dfb6e1690eaeac5db
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a trigger to call ldap_backend define

Ldap_backend is a define so we need a resource to talk it. If
ldap_backend_enable set by tripleo-heat-templates, we call the
ldap_backend as a resource.

Given an environment such as the following:

parameter_defaults:
  KeystoneLdapDomainEnable: true
  KeystoneLDAPBackendConfigs:
    tripleoldap:
      url: ldap://192.0.2.250
      user: cn=openstack,ou=Users,dc=redhat,dc=example,dc=com
      password: Secrete
      suffix: dc=redhat,dc=example,dc=com
      user_tree_dn: ou=Users,dc=redhat,dc=example,dc=com
      user_filter: "(memberOf=cn=OSuser,ou=Groups,dc=redhat,dc=example,dc=com)"
      user_objectclass: person
      user_id_attribute: cn
      user_allow_create: false
      user_allow_update: false
      user_allow_delete: false
  ControllerExtraConfig:
    nova::keystone::authtoken::auth_version: v3
    cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_version: v3

It would then create a domain called tripleoldap with an LDAP
configuration as defined by the hash. The parameters from the
hash are defined by the keystone::ldap_backend resource in
puppet-keystone.

More backends can be added as more entries to that hash.

Partial-Bug: 1677603
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Guillaume Cor <gucore@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1593c6a33ed1a0ea51feda9dfb6e1690eaeac5db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/29/451829/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix edit consistency group form error

If cgroup old description is empty and also judge its length,
it will throw an error. We should first whether is empty.

Change-Id: Ic89232b22a3d4673b14115e65dd670dded26f0a1
Closes-Bug: 1680506

commit_message:
Note about CLA in the preparation section of index.html

For corporate workers it is important to know beforehand that
an ICLA needs to be signed. This change adds a note about the
ICLA to the preparation section.

Change-Id: I28f5cdb466c8ca2de98b0a5ea2a6471a51fdb4f5
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

Use detailRoute constant for path of details view

This patch replaces hard coded "project/ngdetails/" for path of
details view to constant using "horizon.app.core.detailRoute".

commit_message:
Fix the existence check in DataTable Column

Previously DataTable Column checks whether a field exists or not
by checking a result of dict.get(). This has a side effect that
the check complains a field does not exist even when the field
value is None. This commit change the logic to use hasattr to
handle a field with None.

Change-Id: I6ef5ccf90aefd3c407f91a5f3a633d8f68593339
Closes-Bug: #1675912

commit_message:
Simplify legacy hieradata check to avoid false positive.

It seems that the current check for legacy hieradata can be fooled by
the way os-apply-config get its cached data.  This simplify the check
to avoid those false positives.

Change-Id: I4bf3a19b2ba87d902e1ca97de785190de1367c1f
Closes-Bug: #1680006

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Icbfc8958fe430fdd42a569819a8221a32ab681a5

commit_message:
Add sem-ver flag so pbr generates correct version

tl;dr : without this Ocata and Pike have the same version causing
packaging issues.


https://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/#version

Because projects don't push a tag before milestone 1 (pike-1 here),
downstream packages are still building packages by using the version
from Ocata and it causes problems to distros because they can't test
the upgrades from Ocata to Pike.

Bumping the semver will allow us to test packages upgrades.
Note: When your version is X.Y.Z, feature will bump Y, and api-break
will bump X. In this patch, we bump Y because this is the way you
bump tags over releases.


Change-Id: I96a13290182a88f9bae47ec8b5be34beccad45d4
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Remove subunit-trace fork

This makes tox use the latest version of the tool from os-testr repo,
which contains some valuable changes, like the one making the gate fail
if for some reason no tests are executed because all of them are
skipped.

Change-Id: If88be4b310d746ccc885e3d0c1db8a4dfabb2a28

commit_message:
Automatically get pools capabilities for flavor

For Zaqar API v2, admin user can't set the capabilities for flavor
manually. So the field was always empty. This patch fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1679891

Change-Id: I2c9068c849cbfc7b5d2651627a5db7f9025d1473

commit_message:
Stop showing json deserialized message in log

We stop showing json deserialized message in debug log, because
message will involved with some private credential message (like
password). Let's block it for now, until we get a better solution.
Partial-Bug: #1664792

commit_message:
Bumps os-win to 2.0.0

os-win 2.0.0 added support for adding switch port
profile IDs, which is necessary for adding support for
the Windows 2016 Network Controller in networking-hyperv.

os-win 2.0.0 added utils necessary for nova-assisted volume
snapshots for Hyper-V VMs.

Change-Id: Icf2c7d413093a76ce00eae60166c9274c9aec60f

commit_message:
Corrects Ceilometer installation, fixes typo

- removes duplicate Listen directive in wsgi-template.conf.erb that gets
  emitted in ports.conf that the apache2 cookbook lays down
- adds a run directory for ceilometer api socket

commit_message:
Blacklist Babel 2.4.0

Babel 2.4.0 does not handle "-" in locale po files
like "ko-KR". This is fixed now for the upcoming Babel 2.4.1 release.

To be able to publish translated content, blacklist Babel 2.4.0.

For details, see
https://github.com/python-babel/babel/issues/489

Change-Id: I3bd63b3c4798270890c7cabe1d4e7aedf1aaa1ed

commit_message:
Remove calculation for NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork

This patch removes the calculation that set the
NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork configuration based on the number of
"controllers" being deployed. With composable roles, this is incorrect
and the default, if required, should be determined by the number of
neutron dhcp agent services being deployed - not a role count.

Closes-Bug: #1632721
Depends-On: I06628764c4769d91bbc42efe1c722702d6574d02
Change-Id: If202a8255f8ad9f662f0d66a5f630f1b7ae60a26
(cherry picked from commit 1051880e92a46a508bc92da01f4beb7a9203525b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/22/442022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Scaling needs extra parameters number_controllers = int(parameters.get('ControllerCount', 0)) dhcp_agents_per_network = (min(number_controllers, 3) if number_controllers else 1) parameters.update({ 'NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork': dhcp_agents_per_network, })

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-05 18:53:42.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.j2.yaml', 'puppet/puppet-steps.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/77aa9a71020157f21b8898958a6d472b6297ac36', 'message': "Generate Pre/Post Puppet Tasks for all roles

We need to generate the Pre and Post Puppet Tasks for all roles, not
just the Controller role. Otherwise, you have to have a role
specifically named Controller that is running your pacemaker services,
or pacemaker won't be properly handled on stack-updates.

When using deployed-server's it's actually not possible to have a role
called Controller, since we need to use all custom roles so that we can
set disable_contraints on each role. Further, it is not possible to
redefine the Controller role since puppet/controller-role.yaml is listed
in the excludes file.

Change-Id: I737b24db90932e292b50b122640f66385f2d1c23
Partial-Bug: #1665060
(cherry picked from commit 529768ae84f7713f2ae9447ff35ee2d63b4bdcd7)
"}]
commit_message:
Generate Pre/Post Puppet Tasks for all roles

We need to generate the Pre and Post Puppet Tasks for all roles, not
just the Controller role. Otherwise, you have to have a role
specifically named Controller that is running your pacemaker services,
or pacemaker won't be properly handled on stack-updates.

When using deployed-server's it's actually not possible to have a role
called Controller, since we need to use all custom roles so that we can
set disable_contraints on each role. Further, it is not possible to
redefine the Controller role since puppet/controller-role.yaml is listed
in the excludes file.

Change-Id: I737b24db90932e292b50b122640f66385f2d1c23
Partial-Bug: #1665060
(cherry picked from commit 529768ae84f7713f2ae9447ff35ee2d63b4bdcd7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/30/453830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {{role.name}}PrePuppet: type: OS::TripleO::Tasks::{{role.name}}PrePuppet properties: servers: {get_param: [servers, {{role.name}}]} {{role.name}}PostPuppet: depends_on: - {{role.name}}ExtraConfigPost type: OS::TripleO::Tasks::{{role.name}}PostPuppet properties: servers: {get_param: [servers, {{role.name}}]}
deleted_lines: {% if role.name == 'Controller' %} ControllerPrePuppet: type: OS::TripleO::Tasks::ControllerPrePuppet properties: servers: {get_param: [servers, Controller]} {% endif %} {% if role.name == 'Controller' %} ControllerPostPuppet: depends_on: - ControllerExtraConfigPost type: OS::TripleO::Tasks::ControllerPostPuppet properties: servers: {get_param: [servers, Controller]} {% endif %}

commit_message:
Blacklist Babel 2.4.0

Babel 2.4.0 does not handle "-" in locale po files like "ko-KR". This is
fixed now for the upcoming Babel 2.4.1 release.

To be able to publish translated content, blacklist Babel 2.4.0.

Change-Id: Iba67e38da6f8c6773d91c4fd63d9467fb9dc5c90

  enabled by default.
- removes executable bit from metadata.rb

commit_message:
Allow config for high and medium severity key sizes

The severity level of various key sizes of RSA, DSA, and EC are
currently hard-coded in the weak_cryptographic_key.py itself. This
patch allows the values to be overriden via the config file mechanism.

Change-Id: I38ad5384e0e6012818bbac10f449840de6fb14ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bandit refs/changes/96/436196/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def gen_config(name): if name == 'weak_cryptographic_key': return { 'weak_key_size_dsa_high': 1024, 'weak_key_size_dsa_medium': 2048, 'weak_key_size_rsa_high': 1024, 'weak_key_size_rsa_medium': 2048, 'weak_key_size_ec_high': 160, 'weak_key_size_ec_medium': 224, } def _classify_key_size(config, key_type, key_size): 'DSA': [(config['weak_key_size_dsa_high'], bandit.HIGH), (config['weak_key_size_dsa_medium'], bandit.MEDIUM)], 'RSA': [(config['weak_key_size_rsa_high'], bandit.HIGH), (config['weak_key_size_rsa_medium'], bandit.MEDIUM)], 'EC': [(config['weak_key_size_ec_high'], bandit.HIGH), (config['weak_key_size_ec_medium'], bandit.MEDIUM)],def _weak_crypto_key_size_cryptography_io(context, config): return _classify_key_size(config, key_type, key_size) return _classify_key_size(config, key_type, key_size) def _weak_crypto_key_size_pycrypto(context, config): return _classify_key_size(config, key_type, key_size)def weak_cryptographic_key(context, config): return (_weak_crypto_key_size_cryptography_io(context, config) or _weak_crypto_key_size_pycrypto(context, config))
deleted_lines: def _classify_key_size(key_type, key_size): 'DSA': [(1024, bandit.HIGH), (2048, bandit.MEDIUM)], 'RSA': [(1024, bandit.HIGH), (2048, bandit.MEDIUM)], 'EC': [(160, bandit.HIGH), (224, bandit.MEDIUM)],def _weak_crypto_key_size_cryptography_io(context): return _classify_key_size(key_type, key_size) return _classify_key_size(key_type, key_size) def _weak_crypto_key_size_pycrypto(context): return _classify_key_size(key_type, key_size)def weak_cryptographic_key(context): return (_weak_crypto_key_size_cryptography_io(context) or _weak_crypto_key_size_pycrypto(context))

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-04 10:03:50.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/formatters/test_xml.py', 'bandit/core/config.py', 'bandit/core/test_set.py', 'bandit/cli/main.py', 'bandit/cli/config_generator.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bandit/commit/693f57faaecbaeab338e173adbecc8fd566fcc79', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I5340fa3d71b6fba76e8fcf75f9f30432329023d2
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I5340fa3d71b6fba76e8fcf75f9f30432329023d2

commit_message:
Fix availability_zone issues in nova driver

When getting availability_zones from Nova, SDK will return an
object of AvailabilityZone class which is processed further by
SDK instead of a respond body from Nova.

Change-Id: Idf1eaf092b2bb860e1784604fd44d3974cd0572c
Closes-bug: #1680359
(cherry picked from commit 18c66f9db58999adb9bf39a5557f90f519cedcc2)

commit_message:
Add file package for yum-minimal

It seems like yum/dnf are not finding the dependency for
"/usr/bin/file" required by redhat-lsb-core package.  It seems
possibly this has to do with ordering of packages on the command line;
the package-installs.yaml gets squashed into a dict which can change
around.

Let's try just installing file explicitly.

Change-Id: I90a856c137d959e9734434e83c7be447db7a0547

commit_message:
add systemd bindings library for oslo.log

A new feature of oslo.log will allow us to log directly to systemd. Add
the library needed for that optional mode.

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes, by the systemd team - https://github.com/systemd/python-systemd

- Is the library good code?

  It seems pretty reasonable, it's honestly mostly python to clib
  bindings for systemd.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Trove classification says yes. And it's packaged for both python 2
  and 3 in Ubuntu, so I'm assuming yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  LGPLv2+ so yes.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Yes.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  No.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  This is for oslo.log, the commit landed here -
  If2591576a96d8ca6e36f4dc6600f5412f40509e2

Change-Id: I8d1cfeffafce810fb30db24d55aea43759291aad
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Don't use Tempest internal methods
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-27 20:31:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/commit/f24af981ece723b644d3a61f8e2b0c057cf18ff4', 'message': "Don't use Tempest internal methods

All changed methods are clearly internal methods of Tempest, and the
Tempest commit 64e6b4457c748f74bfb4fbf3860ab65b65ae9beb has removed
the internal methods and now the gate issue happens.
This patch makes this project to use better ones instead.

Conflicts:

commit_message:
Don't use Tempest internal methods

All changed methods are clearly internal methods of Tempest, and the
Tempest commit 64e6b4457c748f74bfb4fbf3860ab65b65ae9beb has removed
the internal methods and now the gate issue happens.
This patch makes this project to use better ones instead.

Conflicts:
	neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/base.py

Change-Id: I5d41652a85cfb91646bb48d38eedbe97741a97c2
Related-Bug: #1667824
(cherry picked from commit 18db6d460cd45f92c19f1225823f83aaaa4e8a7f)

added_lines: Tools for automated neutron diagnosis ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ easyOVS is a useful tool when it comes to operating your OpenvSwitch bridges and iptables in Openstack platform. It automatically associates the virtual ports with the vm MAC/IP, VLAN Tag and namespace information, as well as the iptables rules for vm. Don is another convenient network analysis and diagnostic syetem that provides a completely automated service for verifying and diagnosing the networking functionality provided by OVS. Additionally, you can refer to :ref:`neutron-debug` for more options.

commit_message:
Update the instructions and scripts needed for devstack

A few things have been updated in code but not in the READMEs
and scripting to allow a devstack deployment of Ceilosca
on top of a Ceilometer checkout.  This commit should fix that.

Most notable, the devstack/plugin.sh was modified to include
copying the ceilosca_mapping directory in to ceilometer.

Change-Id: I269f5ec12c95c6ab2c0149ecc12811edbb60585e

commit_message:
Initialize plugin for OSC

Initial Octavia client command to list load balancers in a given
project.

Sets up many of the base classes and base files needed for
the rest of the client when it comes up.

Change-Id: I5d426e1a3a364abbe77edea5e8aaad2c8c2213c1

commit_message:
Unity driver: fail to disconnect volume

Some duplicate target_wwn were returned as in the connection_properties,
which would cause the second time of deleting the same device failure.

Closes-Bug: #1665206
Change-Id: Ia944e03b132726193cf1a13575fe22684b531f96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/60/434660/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: if logged_in_only: ports = [] ports.extend(filter(lambda p: (allowed_ports is None or p.get_id() in allowed_ports), paths.fc_port)) return [po.wwn.replace(':', '')[16:] for po in ports]

commit_message:
Explicitly list neutron api extensions for tests

Recent changes to neutron and gate hooks can cause the api extension
list to not include "all" but a neutron specific list.  This means
lbaasv2 may not be included in api extension list.  This will cause
tempest to skip the neutron-lbaas tests.

This change explictly adds "all,lbaasv2" for the network extensions.

Change-Id: I3836562363e9b66a8173b1c73e2538e2ce2a4922
(cherry picked from commit 5d523cf3b859c088ed908492b9112d10ca4eaf23)
(cherry picked from commit f2c493acb8c73f0531382688d6a352274864150d)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/01/453001/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== LBaaS Alternative Health Monitoring Port ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/octavia/+spec/example In the current state, the monitoring port is derived from the protocol port of load balancer's pool members. In some use cases it would be desirable to monitor a different port for the health of the load balanced pool's members than the port defined by the protocol port of the members. Due to the current state this is not possible. Problem description =================== The use case where this would be desirable would be when the End User is making the health monitor application on the member available on a port that is mutually exclusive to the port of the application that is being load balanced on the member. The End User would find this advantageous when attempting to limit access to health diagnostic information by not allowing it to be served over the main ingress port of their application. Beyond limiting access to any health APIs, it allows the End Users to design different methods of health monitoring, such as creating distinct daemons responsible for the health of their hosts applications. Proposed change =============== The creation of a health monitor would now allow the specification of a port to monitor. If no port is specified the default behavior would be to use the port specified by the member. There would likely need to be some Horizon changes to support this feature, however by maintaining the old behavior as the default we will not create a strong dependency. Alternatives ------------ An alternative is to not allow this functionality, and force all End Users to ensure their health checks are available over the member's protocol port. As stated in the *Problem Description* this would force End Users to provide additional security around their health diagnostic information so that they do not expose it to unintended audiences. Pushing this requirement on the End User is a heavier burden and limits their configuration options of the applications they run on Openstack that are load balanced. Data model impact ----------------- The HealthMonitor data model would gain a new member variable called protocol port to store the port that the monitor will query for the health of the load balancer's listener's pool member. It is important to have the default behavior fall back on the protocol port of the member as this will allow any migrations to not break existing deployments of Openstack. Any HealthMonitor data models without this new feature would have a field for protocol port with the value -1 to signify that Octavia's LBaaS service should use the member's protocol port to assess health status. REST API impact --------------- There are two APIs that will need to be modified, only slightly, to facilitate this change. POST /v2.0/lbaas/health_monitors PUT /v2.0/lbaas/health_monitors/{health_monitor_id} These two calls will need an additional field added to their JSON body data for the request and the JSON response data. The field to be added to each is: .. csv-table:: CSVTable :header: Attribute Name,Type,Access,Default Value,Validation Conversion,Description protocol_port,int,"RW, all",-1,int,health check port (optional) Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- Other plugins not have to implement this feature as it is optional due to the default behavior. If they decide to implement this feature, they would just need to supply the protocol port in their POSTs and PUTs to the health monitor APIs. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: a.amerine Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- - Alter HealthMonitor Data Model - Alter HealthMonitor APIs - Write or Alter Tests to verify new functionality Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Integration tests can be written to verify functionality. Generally, it should only require an existing Openstack deployment that is running LBaaS to verify health checks. Documentation Impact ==================== The REST API impact will need to be addressed in documentation so developers moving forward know about the feature and can use it. References ========== .. Octavia Roadmap Considerations: Health monitoring on alternate IPs and/or ports https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Octavia/Roadmap

commit_message:
Fix availability_zone issues in nova driver

When getting availability_zones from Nova, SDK will return an
object of AvailabilityZone class which is processed further by
SDK instead of a respond body from Nova.

Change-Id: Idf1eaf092b2bb860e1784604fd44d3974cd0572c
Closes-bug: #1680359

commit_message:
WIP: Start removing _lookup_instance

As the comments in this method explain, this was for
the transition to cells v2 and a lot of this method
is talking about things that are done now, like cells
v2 is required and instance creation happens in conductor
now.

This patch removes a bunch of the transition code so we
can start unwinding the need for this method at all
since _get_instance should be all we really need in the
end.

Change-Id: I1572028be4ac97b6b2a4c03bd51529cfd4ab85c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/05/443405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-05 11:52:14.000000000', 'files': ['blazar/manager/service.py', 'blazar/api/v1/validation.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/blazar/commit/a8542f11feb06d7439cd3c455e81f118586d12c2', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I1ca4470fe8aae2098899b3f7ed29f83b56d57f79

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1ca4470fe8aae2098899b3f7ed29f83b56d57f79

SPEC for on-end-options

Related to blueprint on-end-options

Change-Id: I11aca151791040e83b34b34cd69818750f054c22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/70/445270/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Add options for on-end action ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/blazar/+spec/on-end-options For host reservation feature, we propose to change the behavior at the end of a lease to force-delete running instances for avoiding failure of other following leases. In addition, we propose to add options for the action taken before the force-deletion. Problem description =================== Currently, the physical host reservation feature does not terminate running instances at the end of lease period. That can cause failures of other following leases. The solution is to delete the instances by default and provide options for the action before the deletion. e.g. snapshot. Use Cases --------- * All user want Blazar to be punctual for guaranteeing a fairness for all leases. * A user wants snapshots of instances if the workload does not finish in the lease period. Then, he will resume the snapshotted instances and restart the workload at the next lease period. * A user wants to use instances just temporally. And he wants those instances to be just auto-deleted at the end of the lease period. Proposed change =============== Change the on_end() method of the PhysicalHostPlugin class to delete running instances at the end of the lease period by default. Furthermore, support options for the action taken before the deletion. Add a new event 'action_before_end' that triggers the actions. This event is registered and changed at the creation of a lease and update of a lease. A default action can be configured and users can specify the action turough a parameter of requests. Add 'safety_time', a time window kept for completing the actions before the deletion of instances. A default safety_time can be configured and users can specify the the safety_time through a parameter of requrests. Supported before_end actions: * snapshot : Take snapshots of running instances before deletion. * [Agreed NOT to support] keep_running : Keep instances running. We expect other options will be proposed in the future. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- * A new event 'action_before_end' will be added * A new 'action_before_end' method will be added to the ManageService class and corresponding 'before_end' method will be added to the PhysicalHostPlugin class. REST API impact --------------- * URL: POST /v2/leases Add parameters: * before_end_action * safety_time * URL: PUT /v2/leases Add parameters: * before_end_action * safety_time Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. (keep existing before-end notifications) Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- * A deployer should care following configs: * before_end_action * safety_time Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: hiro-kobayashi Work Items ---------- * STEP1: Change the behavior at the end of a lease to force-delete running instances. * STEP2: Add the before-end action. Implements corresponding methods and events, and add'before_end_action' and 'safety_time' configs. * STEP3: Add 'before_end_action' and 'safety_time' parameters to REST APIs. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Add following tests: * Unit tests * STEP1: Check all running instances being deleted at the end of lease. * STEP2: Check the before-end action being triggered and completed * STEP3: Check the new parameters being correctly processed. Documentation Impact ==================== Update following documents: * Add a release note * Blazar REST API docs (API v2 docs will be auto updated.) References ========== * Discussion log: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/blazar/2017/blazar.2017-03-07-09.00.log.html History ======= None. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Pike - Introduced

subject: Layer-3 Networking multi-NS-with-EW-enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-22 03:02:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/ccaab6a0a8217913b36fe5431f87edb3d9eab716', 'message': "Layer-3 Networking multi-NS-with-EW-enabled

1. What is the problem?
Multiple north-south external network topology is supported,
but the east-west networking for local networks across multiple
OpenStack cloud has not been supported yet.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
In multi-region cloud depoyment, a requirement is that each
OpenStack cloud provides external network, north-south traffic
is expected to be handled locally for shortest path, and/or
use multiple external networks to help application north-south
traffic redundancy, at the same time east-west networking of
tenant's networks between OpenStack cloud is also needed.
This path will introduce east-west gateway router to address
the east-west networking for local networks in different
OpenStack clouds.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
East-west gateway router.

Change-Id: Ie92fc268249371fba86b19e9d070793e24199c91
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

but the east-west networking for local networks across multiple

OpenStack cloud provides external network, north-south traffic
